turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey Lloyd. This looks like another one of your mix tapes.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Maybe the pirate who buried this treasure chest made it. Put it on.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: That makes total sense. The treasure chest was in his office. Which means Principal Collins is a pirate! I'm surprised Captain Rob never mentioned him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's because Captain Rob is not a pirate. We've been through this.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What was it Jessica wanted us to do with this chest again?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Something about showing the world what Principal Collins has done.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Right. She's so proud of her boyfriend.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What? What did we do?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: We never thanked him for giving us our Special Needs class.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's what Jessica was talking about!

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: She wants us to show the world what a great guy Principal Collins is.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And like she said, do it before the parade.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: A float!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's it. Build him a float for the Thanksgiving Day parade!

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: HARRY, we found the real thing to be thankful for. Screw George Washington!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yes. Screw George Washington. Just like Marilyn Monroe did.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ready Lloyd?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Put a fork in me Harry, lets get started.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Wait, wait!

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: HARRY, are we gonna build this thing or not?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: LLOYD, what I'm saying is we may already have what we want.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Guys, this is much better.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS is a greater American than George Washington will ever be.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh my god. Can you believe your ears?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Yeah! No more clicks and whistles! Now she speaks perfect English!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're a great teacher, Lloyd.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Start the tape, Lloyd.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Roger that, Wilco.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, good. There's Jessica.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: How could she miss this? This whole salute to Collins was her idea.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey there goes Principal Collins!

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: He's so modest. Probably embarrassed by all the attention.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, that's too bad, this is his day.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh my God! She's two-timing PRINCIPAL COLLINS!

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: And with that complete loser

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Ya know Harry, I think this whole experience has soured me on women.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, we should never let a woman come between us again.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I don't think that'll happen. We've learned a valuable lesson we won't ever forget.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hold up. First, we have to decide who gets who, remember? No more competition?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Okay. Which one do you want?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The one on the left.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Damn! What are the odds?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: That's the one I wanted.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's one of a kind.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Try one in a million!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, what should we do?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You take her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No Lloyd. Chicks are for fags - I'm not going to do it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sorry, Charlie.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hey, where'd you go?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Beats me. It's Jessica's Dad - she said he's really anal.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: That's gross.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: MS. HELLER, mind if I tag along on your field trip? I'm thinking of doing a story on your special needs class.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: I'm not interested. Not after the smear story you did on my chicken sushi.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Well, when 200 students are hospitalized with stomach cramps I think it's newsworthy.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Nevertheless, you could have mentioned the sauce.  Well, I see you have a camera.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: So can I come along?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Are you wearing a coconut bra?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Oh, you're good.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Why are you teaching Special Needs? You're the lunch lady.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Dietician! This interview is over. You can have the camera back tomorrow. Come by the classroom. Heller heads off.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: You mean the lunch room?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: I thought I told you to get lost.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Look Ms. Heller, there's something fishy here, and I don't think it's Friday's special.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: I wouldn't know. Being that I'm just the teacher and all.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: You had some questions.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Last year Toby was in A.P. English. And Lewis won the Science Fair. What are they doing in Special Needs?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Poor question. Too wordy. A good question gets right to the point. Example, where's my chest?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Oh I think you do.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: My parents are going to wonder where I am.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: One phone call from the principal will take care of that, my dear.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: So what did you say to my parents on the phone?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Not to expect you tonight.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: I'm going to ask you one last time and if I don't get an answer, I don't even want to think about the consequences which would be frightening to say the least. Where's my chest, Jessica?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Well, what have we here? It appears be a tape.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: That's not your tape.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Then where did you get this not my tape.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: THAT'S NOT YOUR TAPE.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Don't play with me dear, you're way out of your league.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: TURK, leave him alone.

turns.speaker: TURK
turns.text: TURK, leave him alone.  You're coming too.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: TURK, what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: TURK
turns.text: Special Needs class.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Being a jerk doesn't make you special.

turns.speaker: TURK
turns.text: You're just jealous.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: And, Ching Chong, you're not a Special Needs kid. You're just a foreign exchange student.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hey, Turk rescued you from the nerd. You're in!

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I'll talk to you later.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: HARRY, I heard Collins has you in some kind of special class.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: If dou're trying to get in, dou're doo late.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Oh no, I know that class isn't for me. But I'm happy for you guys.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Why ith dat newth?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: This school's never had one before. I'd like to talk to you and all your special friends.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Yes, what?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Don't answer me. Say what I say.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Well I was born in St. Louis.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Do you want me to pet your head?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Checking up on my friend, Harry.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Oh Harry's doing just fine, he's just about to open up.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You know, "some". The fag stuff.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: HARRY and I have been talking about school. In fact, I want to ask you something.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I know, you want go for a ride.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Where'd that come from? He holds up a giant key chain.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Come on, I live with the janitor. I have a key to every room in the school.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: So could you get us into the principal's office?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Principal's office? Yeah, I guess I can swing that.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: So, when can we do it?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Tomorrow night?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Oh, baby, you're the bestest.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Oh, go on.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Well, something stinks.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Maybe it's this mix tape I made you. Or maybe these flowers. He gives Jessica the flowers and tape.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Uh, thanks. God I'm so excited! So, are you ready to take me to the principal's office? He whips out the key, she takes it.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: So no small talk? Good, 'cause I don't know how to make that. Yep. Small talk. Not for me. Not a fan.  Got any hobbies? How 'bout this weather?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Let's just do it and get out of here.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I'm so close I can feel it.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Me too. I'm almost there.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: That's it. I'm done.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: That was fast. Well, did you at least enjoy it?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: No, it was a complete waste of time.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: This is so embarrassing, it's never happened before. Well, maybe a couple of times, but I was alone.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: That's my boyfriend.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Boyfriend? What about all that talk about riding my waxer?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Thanks, Lloyd. But I didn't find what I was looking for. Oh can you do me a favor and clean up? Collins can't know we were here.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: HARRY! Lloyd! You guys are a mess.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Looks like the best man won.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: ... If I may quote the twentieth century poet  - Joe Piscahpo:  You look Marvelous...

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: LLOYD, when we were in Principal Collins's office, did you see any kind of chest?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: HARRY's treasure chest? Sure. I know where that is.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Don't worry about me, I'll be fine. I can take care of myself and I'm getting the story every high school reporter dreams of.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: "My dream date with Principal Collins."

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: He's going to be in jail for a long time.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Principal of jail. Wow. What a promotion.

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: Well I need to get a job and you're telling me that if I join up - I can really come and go whenever I want?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You were born free and free you should remain.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: Duh. I'm in your class at school.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Oh my God, it's really you. You're HARRY's friend, right?

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: I don't know if you'd call us "friends"...

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You really are a pirate.

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: Can you believe it?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: So I'm an "arrrrrs-hole", eh Captain Rob?

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hello, little orphan boy. What happened to you?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Skateboard.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: What? It's nothing, the cast comes off in six weeks.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Of course it does.  Obviously in denial.  Maybe we can help.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: How much homework is there?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: That's the downside. There is none.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Wait a minute. I can spend the whole year in a class taught by the lunch lady? Can I bring my girlfriend?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You can bring whatever you want, little friend.

turns.speaker: TEN YEAR-OLD KID
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Go in there and get us two slushees.

turns.speaker: TEN YEAR-OLD KID
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Do we have a deal?

turns.speaker: TEN YEAR-OLD KID
turns.text: Yeah, deal. Give me the two dollars.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Ha! I said "doll-hairs." Psych! But a deal's a deal, my friend. In you go.

turns.speaker: TEN YEAR-OLD KID
turns.text: Fine. Give me the doll hairs.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Uh-oh. Harry?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Thanks for the grub, Mrs. D. Where's Mr. D?

turns.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
turns.text: He passed away three years ago.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Well he missed a great pot of stew!

turns.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
turns.text: It was meatloaf. You just put everything in your soup.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I liked it a lot.

turns.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
turns.text: Hey you two. Lights out.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hey can be on top?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Mrs. D! I was hoping you'd show up.

turns.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
turns.text: Oh honey, I wouldn't miss this for the world.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Have you got what I want?

turns.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
turns.text: You know I do!

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Oh yeah, give it to me.

turns.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
turns.text: How was that?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: It's too close to call.  Okay next contest, now lets...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Senior year. My little boy. Who woulda thunk it?  You're a good kid, Lloyd. I don't say it enough, but I'm proud of you son.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Thanks, Pop.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: LLOYD, may I see you a minute?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Class, please study on your own. There seems to be a family emergency because there's no other reason why my father would interrupt me WHILE I'M WORKING!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What are you crazy kids doing in my tool shed?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: We're not crazy. We're "special". PRINCIPAL COLLINS wants us to have our own classroom!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My boy's special, well how about that. I knew you were different.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: So I guess you'll need a new spot for your moonshine.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I reckon so.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Your assignment is to pick the class. Find some other students just as special as you.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Will that be on the midterm?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Sorry, Ms. Heller. I think they're used to me teaching.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: People! Come on. "Parade" float.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: That's not bad. How about a float of George Washington crossing the Delaware?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Or maybe crossing a river!

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Obviously.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: So miss snoopy reporter girl, it appears that you've snooped yourself into a corner and snoopcuffed yourself to a desk. Whose wearing the Coconut bra now?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Let's go Margie. The museum ain't going to teach itself.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Museum huh, haven't been there since my husband left me. I love art.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Looking for a scoop, huh? I'll give you a scoop... of short bus.  Lose her!

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Loser... oh yeah he was a loser alright. A big loser.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: He was a big loser! What are you deaf!?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Uh, no and I don't appreciate...turn down here!

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: That's great, now make a left, then straight!

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Oh, yeah he was straight all right, just wasn't very good in the sack. I used to give him directions. Higher, lower, faster, harder, small circles, do the alphabet. Useless.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Left here! Left!

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: You bet I left him, took the dog and we was history.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Ha! Too big to make the turn!

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: No, it actually fit quite nicely.  Well, except for the fact that it wasn't really as long as it was wide.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: I think you did it.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Damn right I did it. Went back and set the house on fire, his little floozy testified in court - and I ended up doing ten years at Rikers, got my teeth knocked out by Mike the Dyke.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ZIMMER
turns.text: I'm not sure if I can do this.

turns.speaker: MOFFIT
turns.text: Sure you can. We gotta nail this guy. You'll be fine.

turns.speaker: ZIMMER
turns.text: Collins can be a pretty crafty guy, what do I do if he smells the trap.

turns.speaker: MOFFIT
turns.text: I don't think he'll smell anything - just make sure he takes the check. I've been through this a hundred times.

turns.speaker: ZIMMER
turns.text: Well you know Detective, he's expecting  'Moffit' to be someone who has... certain... well...

turns.speaker: MOFFIT
turns.text: Yeah, I get it. Don't worry I studied acting at the police academy just let me do the talking and you'll be fine.

turns.speaker: MOFFIT
turns.text: I am strong!

turns.speaker: ZIMMER
turns.text: Yes you are.

turns.speaker: MOFFIT
turns.text: I can turn on all the faucets in my house.  Even the hose.

turns.speaker: ZIMMER
turns.text: But we don't drink from the house do we.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: ... and, Principal Collins, you'll be pleased to know that this year Wednesdays are "South of the Border" days. We'll serve a spicy tuna tamale along with a cheese quesadilla.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Good. Good. Good. Well, that's good.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: God, I've missed you.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: And I you.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: You know honey, I've finally figured out a way of bilking enough money from the school to get us that condo in Waikiki.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: How baby-cakes? You've done it all.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Small potatoes. This one is big time. This is visionary. This idea is genius.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: It's the big potato.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Yes, it's the big potato. Just have a look at this.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Anyway, the state is giving a hundred thousand dollars in his name to every school that has a Special Needs class.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Oh, this is fantastic. So all we have to do is kill this Moffit guy and we get all the money!

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: No. No. That's not it. We don't kill him. We don't kill anybody. But I like the way you're thinking. You're focused and you're trying to follow. No, what we need to do is start a fake Special Needs class.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: We start our own class?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Maybe someday. Aloha cold weather, aloha hot weather.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: You said "aloha" twice.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Aloha means hello and goodbye.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Oh wow. Look at you.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Times two.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: I think you'll make a good teacher.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: To take a picture for Superintendent Zimmer?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: So far so good. We'll need more pictures. Why don't you take them on a field trip tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: And...?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: And, take some more pictures.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Wow, you are smart.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: And you are great in bed.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Knock knock.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Who's there?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Guess what"s under these coconuts.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: It's a surprise.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Well I've got a little surprise for you.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: You got the Extender?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: No. No. I heard from Superintendent ZIMMER this morning and evidently he's so impressed with our Special Needs class, he's bringing Richard MOFFIT himself to the Thanksgiving Day parade- check in hand.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Monkey, this is too exciting! I can't believe our dream is coming true.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: So what do you keep in there?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Oh, things. Photos. Tapes. I tape everything that goes on in this office.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Everything?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Everything. Just for the record.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Oh, just like the President.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Just like the President.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Baby, I'm going to spend the morning at the mall. You know, shop for Waikiki. Honey, what are you looking for?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: The chest! The chest that I put my papers in.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: What papers?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: The documents. The photos! The tapes! The evidence.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: The evidence of what?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Sweetheart keep up with me for half a minute. The evidence of every scam we ever pulled. The evidence that's going to put us away for twenty years.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: I don't know where it is. It's not here. It's been stolen.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Wait a minute, I think I know who stole it.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: No you don't know who stole it. Just let me do the thinking.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: It was Jessica. That girl who tried to follow me on the field trip.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: JESSICA. Are you sure?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: She's been snooping around a lot, asking questions.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Okay, I'll take care of Jessica.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Are you going to kill her?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Why don't you see to it the kids are ready for the parade tomorrow. I have to pay somebody a little visit.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: So the chest is still out there somewhere.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Yes. So as soon as Zimmer shows up, we'll get our check and blow this pop stand before anyone finds out anything.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: This band sounds terrible.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: I sold all the wind instruments.  Hawaiian Air, business class. And you like that new fur coat?

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: Love it!

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: Well there's a reason why that mascot isn't a stallion anymore.

turns.speaker: MS. HELLER
turns.text: This is horse?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
turns.text: No... no it's not horse, you see I sold the horse.

turns.speaker: PITER
turns.text: My Lord!

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Piter.

turns.speaker: PITER
turns.text: The Atreides will be leaving Caladan soon, Baron, and I have here your answer from Duke Leto.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: What does Leto say, Piter?

turns.speaker: PITER
turns.text: He wishes to inform you that Vendetta -- as he puts it, using the ancient tongue, the art of Kanly -- is still alive. He does not wish to meet or speak with you.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I made my peace gesture... the forms of Kanly have been obeyed.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: It was Feyd?  It was Feyd!  Where is the ducal signet ring?  I must have his ring.

turns.speaker: PITER
turns.text: The ring?... he was brought to us as is, Baron.  I...

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: You killed the doctor too soon, you fool!

turns.speaker: DUKE LETO
turns.text: So you are Dr. Kynes, the Imperial Ecologist?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: I prefer the more ancient term, planetologist... Noble Born.

turns.speaker: DUKE LETO
turns.text: This is my son, Paul.

turns.speaker: DUKE LETO
turns.text: I understand we have you to thank for these stillsuits, Doctor.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: They are Fremen suits. I hope they fit well, my lord.

turns.speaker: DUKE LETO
turns.text: My thanks.

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: With your permission...

turns.speaker: DUKE LETO
turns.text: What happens now?

turns.speaker: KYNES
turns.text: The carryall will come and lift off the spice harvester. Try and get in close over the harvester... you'll find this interesting Sire. -- The Duke accelerates the ornithopter in the direction of the harvester. Paul can SEE...
